column4: yes. well, it could depend. what driver are you using? do you have a /etc/X11/xorg.conf file? if so, it might have your video cards chipset as an entry in that file and X reads that when it starts up.
if you don't have that file, then X just runs at some defaults using a generic driver i think
well ubuntu configured it all automatically .. so what do i need to do to install the new video card
i'm not sure. it used to be a command like 'dpkg-reconfigure -plow xserver-xorg' - but i'm not sure if that command is it anymore
